result.execSummary:
The defendant Shermane Leon Lamb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Shermane Leon Lamb appeared. Case called at 10:29 am. Atty Andrea recites agreement. No objection from ADA Correll.   Court amends Count #1 without domestic abuse enhancer. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count #1 w/o domestic abuse enhancer.    Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of amended count #1. Atty Andrea makes sentencing argument. Court Orders:
Court Costs: $114.50
DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200.00

Atty Andrea
Status conference at 10-05-2015 02:15 pm

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, A. Hilderbradt.  Except for purposes of child exchange through a third party. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
